member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.FeatureDataField.GeodatabaseFeature
member.summary: Gets or sets the .

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.FeatureDataField.FieldName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the field from the GeodatabaseFeature.Attributes. The UI input generated will be for this field.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.FeatureDataField.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the UI will be readonly. If IsReadOnly is true then the UI generated will use the ReadOnlyTemplate. Any field that is not readonly can be made readonly, but field that are readonly already as defined by thier FieldInfo entry in GeodatabaseFeature.Schema.Fields cannot be made editable.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.FeatureDataField.BindingValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the binding value.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.FeatureDataField.ValidationException
member.summary: Gets or sets the validation exception. If a validation exception occurs this property will hold the validation Exception. default validation is handled based on FieldInfo found inside GeodatabaseFeature.Schema.Fields. Custom validation can be added by subsribing to ValueChanging event.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.FeatureDataField.SelectorTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the selector template. Selector template is used for fields that are CodeValueDomain types as define in FieldInfo.Domain.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.FeatureDataField.InputTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the input template. This template is used for fields that do not have CodedValueDomain information.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.FeatureDataField.ReadOnlyTemplate
member.summary: Gets or sets the read only template. This template is used for fields that are readonly.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.FeatureDataForm.GeodatabaseFeature
member.summary: Gets or sets the GeodatabaseFeature that contains the information needed to create fields and binding.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.FeatureDataForm.Fields
member.summary: Gets or sets the fields to display. A field will be displayed according to the index of this property.

list.item: if Fields property is "null" or "empty" all supported editable fields will be displayed.
if Fields property contains "*" then all supported fields will be displayed editable and non-editable.

if Fields property contains a specific set of fields "<FieldName1>,<FieldName2>" then only these fields show in the order they are provided. Field names are case sensitive and only supported field types will be rendered.

remarks.pre: The non-supported field types are XML, Blob, Geometry and Raster.

member.summary: The minimum resolution in which this layer can be viewed.

member.summary: The maximum scale in which this layer can be viewed.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.Primitives.LayerItemViewModel.IsEnabled
member.summary: Whether the layer is currently enabled i.e. is checked on.
member.value: true if the layer is currently enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.Primitives.LayerItemViewModel.IsVisible
member.summary: Whether the layer is currently visible (taking care of the ascendants visibility, of the scale range and of the time extent).
member.remarks: The IsVisible property is also taking care of the layer intialization failure (i.e is false whether a layer failed to initialize) and of the tiled layers spatial reference mismatchs (i.e. is false whether the spatial reference of a tiled layer is not the same as the map spatial reference).
member.value: true if the layer is currently visible; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.Primitives.LayerItemViewModel.IsInScaleRange
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is in the scale range to be visible.
member.value: true if this instance is in scale range; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.Primitives.LayerItemViewModel.IsInTimeExtent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this instance is in the time extent to be visible.
member.value: true if this instance is in time extent; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.Primitives.LayerItemViewModel.IsBusy
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this the layer is currently loading its legend.
member.value: true if this instance is busy; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.Primitives.LayerItemViewModel.BusyIndicatorVisibility
member.summary: Gets the busy indicator visibility. The busy indicator is visible while the layer is currently loading its legend.
member.remarks: This value makes sense for map layer items.
member.value: The busy indicator visibility.

member.summary: The collection of under this layer item.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.Primitives.LayerItemViewModel.HideChildren
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the children of this layer item must be hidden in the legend.
member.remarks: When a layer item is hidden, it's no more returned in the enumeration of its parent items, but it's still returned in the enumeration of its parent item.
member.value: true if the children (layerItem and legendItem) must not be displayed in the legend; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.Primitives.LayerItemViewModel.IsHidden
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this layer item must be hidden in the legend.
member.remarks: When a layer item is hidden, it's no more returned in the enumeration of its parent items, but it's still returned in the enumeration of its parent item.
member.value: true if the layer item must not be displayed in the legend; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.Primitives.LayerItemViewModel.IsTransparent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this layer item is transparent, i.e. the item is not displayed in the legend and its children are attached to its parent.
member.value: true if this instance is transparent; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Internal class encapsulating a layer item representing the virtual root item for the legend tree. This class manages the events coming from the map, from the map layers and from the map layer items.

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.Primitives.SymbolDisplay
member.summary:
A control that displays a symbol.
The control creates internally the swatch by using .
If the symbol symbolizes a point feature, the symbol will be displayed at scale without any stretching except if the Height/Width or MaxHeight/MaxWidth are set and don't allow displaying the symbol at scale without clipping. In this case the symbol is stretched to fill the available space.
If the symbol symbolizes a line or a polygon, the swatch size is based on the Height/Width or MaxHeight/MaxWidth. If these properties are not set, a default 32*32 size is used instead.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.Primitives.SymbolDisplay.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Invoked whenever application code or internal processes (such as a rebuilding layout pass) call ApplyTemplate. In simplest terms, this means the method is called just before a UI element displays in your app. Override this method to influence the default post-template logic of a class.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.Primitives.SymbolDisplay.GeometryType
member.summary:
The symbol geometry type ( by default).
If the geometry type is , the geometry type will be deduced from the symbol type. However, in some cases such as a MarkerSymbol used to symbolize a line or an area object, it may be useful to set this parameter.

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.ScaleLine.GetKilometer
member.summary: 1. (target_width_pixels / 96) = target_width_inches 2. target_width_inches * map_scale = map_scale_inches 3. map_scale_inches converted to kilometers = map_scale_kilometers
member.returns: value that represents the maps scale in kilometers

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.ScaleLine.GetMeter
member.summary: 1. (target_width_pixels / 96) = target_width_inches 2. target_width_inches * map_scale = map_scale_inches 3. map_scale_inches converted to meters = map_scale_meters
member.returns: value that represents the maps scale in meters

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.ScaleLine.GetMile
member.summary: 1. (target_width_pixels / 96) = target_width_inches 2. target_width_inches * map_scale = map_scale_inches 3. map_scale_inches converted to miles = map_scale_miles
member.returns: value that represents the maps scale in miles

member.name: M:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Controls.ScaleLine.GetFoot
member.summary: 1. (target_width_pixels / 96) = target_width_inches 2. target_width_inches * map_scale = map_scale_inches 3. map_scale_inches converted to feet = map_scale_feet
member.returns: value that represents the maps scale in feet

member.name: T:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.ThrottleTimer
member.summary: The throttle timer is useful for limiting the number of requests to a method if the method is repeatedly called many times but you only want the method raised once. It delays raising the method until a set interval, and any previous calls to the actions in that interval will be cancelled.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Invokes this instance (note that this will happen asynchronously and delayed).

member.summary: Cancels this timer if running.

member.name: P:Esri.ArcGISRuntime.Toolkit.Internal.ThrottleTimer.Action
member.summary: Delegate to Invoke.
member.value: The action.
